com.ibm.team.repository.common
Interface IContext

public interface IContext

There are 3 access policies supported - Public, Protected and Application managed.

Public access policy must be used for types that will be visible to everyone. For example, Contributor items must be accessible to everyone. So, contributor type must use Public access policy. Items with public access policy would have its context set to IContext.PUBLIC.

Protected access policy must be used when the items must be visible only to the members of the context. The context of the item must be set to the project area id. All the members of the context (project area) can read the items.

Application managed context is used for items whose context is managed by the application.

Components can opt-in to use read access control by specifying the read access policy attribute in ecore model

Since:
0.7

Field Summary
static UUID APPLICATION_MANAGED
          Constant UUID used by items that are managed by the application.
static UUID PUBLIC
          Constant UUID used by the items that are accessible by everyone.
static java.lang.String PUBLIC_CONTEXT_URL
           
 

Field Detail

PUBLIC

static final UUID PUBLIC
Constant UUID used by the items that are accessible by everyone. All the items with a public read access policy should set their context to PUBLIC

APPLICATION_MANAGED

static final UUID APPLICATION_MANAGED
Constant UUID used by items that are managed by the application. Items with a Application Managed read access policy can set their context to APPLICATION_MANAGED or to another value that has meaning to the IComponentPermissionParticipant.

PUBLIC_CONTEXT_URL

static final java.lang.String PUBLIC_CONTEXT_URL
See Also:
